intro: Calycadenia campestris, commonly known as the field flax or desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its narrow, linear leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. Calycadenia campestris is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water from deeper soil layers.
